review: Note: I have been using Nivea Dark Spot Reduction face wash for over a decade before trying this. This is downright the best face wash you can find in Indian market for men. Nivea has been my holy grail in terms of skin care up until recently. This version of Cetaphil scrub has safer and better ingredients than the more popular gentle cleanser. One of the most noticeable advantages this has over Nivea is the moisture retention you get on your face post using this product. This seldom makes your face dry and visible differences can be seen right after the first use. Plus, it has been bamboo and coconut extracts which are very good for your face. Quality: / Quantity: / Packaging: / Effectiveness: / The product is made in Germany. No wonder its so good.

product: Cetaphil Daily Exfoliating Cleanser 178ml, Gently removes dirt and impurities, Buffs Away Dry Dull Skin, For All Skin Types, Non-Irritating, Dermatologically Tested
review: Very good. Can be used daily ; gives an unmatched sense of having "scrubbed down" when you need it. Perfect for sensitive skin prone to breakouts and redness (hypoallergenic and non-comedogenic). The tube in itself is sturdy and compact. Consistency - watery gel with mild granulations. Amount required - very, very little (which makes the price worth it. It'll last you for ages.) Scent - clean and refreshing, one of the main things that attracted me. Lather - not bubbly, but obvious. Washing off - wash off at least twice to remove the residue. In my experience, that's how much is required. Feel - a thorough cleanse. Skin may feel a little tight subsequently, but that's the case with most soaps or facewashes.

product: Beauty of Joseon Green Plum Refreshing Cleanser
review: Update: I stopped double cleansing when I wear sunscreen and used just this by itself and it does so lovely on my skin! The problem I had was not only when I double cleanse my skin doesn't like that so instead I cleanse with BOJ balm or this gel cleanser and then use a toner to make sure everything is removed. But the other problem was when I used it with the water too warm and it flared my rosacea. For the last few evenings I've used this without any other cleanser and lukewarm or cool water and my skin does so much better. Just love BOJ! ---Original review --- I don't use this BOJ Green Plum cleanser every day. This is only for those occasions when I double cleanse after wearing a particularly heavy SPF sunscreen, or maybe if I wear makeup (which is rare since I work remotely). It's a little drying for my dry aging skin. If you have more oily skin, you may love this. I am biased to Beauty of Joseon products, so basically they can do no wrong - lol - but this isn't my favorite cleanser since it is a little drying. Though they do indicate it is 'pore cleansing' so that should have been my clue! I love BOJ ginseng oil based cleanser. And their cleansing balm. Those are my go-tos. I use the oil based cleanser every day. I'll use the balm as the first step in double cleansing or use it on its own for makeup or SPF removal. I won't reorder this but it's not because it is not a great cleanser, it's just not for my aging rosacea-prone skin type.

product: NATUREONE BHA Acne Foam Cleansing, Acne Face Wash, Salicylic Acid for Acne Prone Skin, Exfoliator, Sebum, Blackhead Remover and Dead Cells, Foaming Pore Cleanser, Korean Skincare, 100ml, 3.38 fl.oz.
review: It is definitely foamy, there is a lot of foam and dense, almost too much but that can be controlled by the amount dispensed, so only a very little is needed. The cleansing action is pretty gentle but feels effective as a cleanser without drying or irritation. The ingredients seem decent, with a few natural herbs inside. There is a neutral smell that is of light strength and ok, it is a kind of generic cleanser type of smell with a hint of the herbal ingredients, it only appears when applying to the face but goes away after washing. Overall adequate enough for me to integrate into my morning and night face wash routine.

product: NATUREONE BHA Acne Foam Cleansing, Acne Face Wash, Salicylic Acid for Acne Prone Skin, Exfoliator, Sebum, Blackhead Remover and Dead Cells, Foaming Pore Cleanser, Korean Skincare, 100ml, 3.38 fl.oz.
review: I don't suffer from acne but I do like to use a exfoliating cleanser a few times a week, so I ordered this BHA Acne Foam Cleansing made by NatureONE. The main blemish busters in this cleanser are lauric acid and salicylic acid. Salicylic acid has been around forever and is a proven success for fighting acne, but newer studies have shown that lauric acid also has a lot of potential for attaining clear skin. In addition to those, this product also contains the antibacterial chlorphenesin, and a good blend of humectants and emollients. I had hoped that the hydrating and moisturizing ingredients in this cleanser would help it to not dry out my skin so much. It's definitely a trade-off - after using this cleanser my skin does feel tight and slightly dry but it's worth it to me for the benefit of the BHA in it. And besides, I always moisturize after cleansing. There is no added fragrance in this cleanser but it does smell of the peppermint oil that it contains. It has decent foaming action and I love that the surfactants and preservatives used are not harsh. It is a pretty clean formula with no sulfates, parabens, cyclic silicones or fragrance, but it does contain polyethylene glycol in the form of PEG- hydrogenated castor oil. The issue with PEGs is that during their creation toxic byproducts are released, which can then contaminate the final product. These toxic byproducts include ethylene oxide, a known carcinogen and ,-dioxane, a suspected carcinogen. I avoid skin care products with PEGs, so after using this cleanser a couple times I have stopped. Currently this cleanser is selling for $. and that is a pretty good deal considering all the good ingredients it contains. One star docked for the presence of a PEG, but other than that it is a nice cleanser.

product: COSRX Low pH Good Morning Gel Cleanser 150ml, Daily Mild Face Cleanser for Sensitive Skin with BHA & Tea Tree Oil, PH Balancing, No Parabens, No Sulfates, Korean Skincare
review: Ive been using the COSRX Low pH Cleanser for a while now, and its become one of those products I always come back to. Its super gentle on the skin but still leaves my face feeling clean without that tight, dry feeling afterward. The scent is kind of herbal/tea tree-ish, not super strong, but worth mentioning in case you're sensitive to fragrance. Personally, I dont mind it. The gel texture is really nice and easy to work into the skin, and it rinses off easily too. It works well for my dry skin, clears away the overnight dirt in the morning, and its also great as a second cleanser at night. Doesnt mess with my skin barrier or cause breakouts, which is a big win for me. Overall, a great everyday cleanser thats affordable and reliable. If you like your skincare simple but effective, this is a solid choice.

product: COSRX Low pH Good Morning Gel Cleanser 150ml, Daily Mild Face Cleanser for Sensitive Skin with BHA & Tea Tree Oil, PH Balancing, No Parabens, No Sulfates, Korean Skincare
review: The COSRX Low pH Good Morning Gel Cleanser is a total game-changer in my skincare routine! I have sensitive, combination skin, and its hard to find a cleanser that cleans without stripping my face. This one ticks all the boxesits gentle, effective, and leaves my skin feeling refreshed without any tightness. The low pH formula really helps maintain my skins balance, which is important to avoid breakouts and irritation. I also love that it contains tea tree oil and BHA, which keep my pores clear and calm any redness. Even though its called a morning cleanser, I use it both day and night, and it works beautifully every time. The gel texture feels soothing, and it lathers just the right amount without being too foamy. Plus, the ml bottle lasts a long time since a little bit goes a long way. Its also fragrance-free, which is a bonus for those with sensitive skin or anyone avoiding strong scents. If youre looking for a reliable, gentle daily cleanser that works for all skin typesespecially sensitive or acne-pronethis one is a must-try! Ill definitely be repurchasing.

product: COSRX Low pH Good Morning Gel Cleanser 150ml, Daily Mild Face Cleanser for Sensitive Skin with BHA & Tea Tree Oil, PH Balancing, No Parabens, No Sulfates, Korean Skincare
review: I was a bit skeptical because of the horror stories I have seen on YouTube and other reviews but Im really glad I went for it because this product doesnt irritate my skin or make me break out at all. In fact, every time I use it (I use it at night even though it says good morning which is totally fine) it leaves my skin with this slight glow, which is awesome! It doesnt strip my skin at all like my other cleansers did which messed up my skins natural ph balance and actually CAUSED acne (Grrr skincare industry). If yall havent looked at ph balanced products, you need to unless you want to have acne forever. If you destroy your skins natural moisture barrier and ph levels, you are essentially removing the fence your skin is trying to put up to protect itself which allows all kinds of bacteria to come in and have an acne party on your face. Im using this as a part of my skincare regimen to help restore my skins natural barrier. The product has also helped fade my acne scars and assist with redness. Sometimes I will feel a zit brewing underneath my skin and it wont even come out. I think this is due mainly to the tea tree oil and possibly the evening primrose oil in this. I honestly dont care though because whichever ingredient is responsible for doing this is working. On that note, the product definitely smells like Tea Tree oil. Some people may think the scent smells like chemicals but this is really just the natural scent pure Tea Tree oil has. I personally like it but if the smell is not for you, it doesnt linger at all. A little goes a long way with this product- it is very silky and suds up just slightly when you gently massage it into your skin. The product takes about a week to arrive at least to Texas (I think it must actually ship from Korea lol) but it was worth the wait. I would definitely recommend.

review: Ive been using the ANUA Heartleaf Quercetinol Pore Deep Cleansing Foam for a little while now, and overall, its been a pretty good experience. The first thing I noticed is its creamy texture and how much foam it creates a little goes a long way, and the lather feels really soft and luxurious on the skin. Its super gentle, which makes it great for daily use without stripping away moisture. While my skin feels refreshed and smooth after using it, Im not entirely sure if its doing a deep cleanse for my pores as it claims. I havent noticed a big difference in pore visibility or deep cleaning effects, but as a basic foamy cleanser, it works well for getting rid of surface impurities. If youre looking for a soft, gentle, and foamy cleanser that leaves your skin feeling clean and fresh, this one is worth trying. Just dont expect a miracle when it comes to deep pore cleaning. Still, its a nice product that feels good on the skin!

review: First of all I want to comment that I am a number fan of the Skincare Koreanos. So before taking it out, I move it a little and come out as in the photo (but never imagine in life I had seen a soap that happened to him) On the other hand when rubbing it in the hands it gives a soft foam and then placed on the face, which the sensation is tasty It doesn't leave you dry skin and it's nice. Another negative point is that at night I use double cleaning, first the oil and then this soap. And although with each one it takes about seconds (they count the time and you will see that it is enough) and sometimes I have remains of makeup (eye I do not use waterproof makeup), so I put more in doubt its effectiveness CONCLUSION. I think those Videos of Tiktok and Instagram where they say that this product is miracles is false, it does not seem to me to do their job well, according to the benefits they sell. review: Ive been using the Anua Cleansing Oil and Im honestly obsessed. From the first use, I could tell this was something special. The texture is silky and lightweightit glides over my skin effortlessly and melts away makeup and sunscreen without any harsh rubbing. What really impressed me, though, was how soft and smooth my skin felt afterward. No tightness, no greasy residue, just clean, calm skin. It also has a subtle, calming scent that makes the cleansing routine feel almost spa-like. Plus, my pores look more refined and my skin feels more balanced overall. If youre into double cleansing or just want a gentle yet effective oil cleanser, I cant recommend this enough.

product: ANUA Heartleaf Quercetinol Pore Deep Cleansing Foam, Facial Cleanser, for Double Cleansing, BHA, Hyaluronic Acid, Glycerin, Face Wash, Blackhead Remover, Korean Skincare, 150ml/5.07 fl.oz.
review: I am VERY satisfied with this product so far. It has far exceeded my expectations of a face wash. I am a yr old melanated woman and I smoke - that makes a difference in your skin. I live in the Midwest and it's February so cold frigid dry air right now. I notice that every winter my skin has a number of issues; dry patches, irritated acne, flakey, uneven tone/ashy, and fatigued looking. My face itches for no reason. I try a mixture of tea tree oil and moisturizer, nothing. I wash my face with Cetaphil as I have for over decades, nothing. I finally accepted that it was time to change my routine and products. But I'm not a big consumer of makeup or skin care. I used Cetaphil and ponds for years and it has worked. My best friend recommended this and other products to cleanse, tone, tighten, even, and SPF protector. Reluctantly I ordered it. I received it on February th, today is the th and I already am overwhelmed with hope for this face cleanser. When I got it my face was irritated and itchy so I was a little scared to try it but within the time I've had it, the irritation has greatly deminished and my face doesn't itch as much or as long. My face looks clearer and brighter. I notice I had a little white pimple on my chin days ago. Usually I would've popped it but I wanted to see the product work in real time and it has. I see it literally drying up and my skin isn't crusty or flakey. When I pat my face, I can see the skin that was exfoliated simply peel or wipe away. The effectiveness of this product is exactly what I read and what I needed! Lastly, a little goes a long way so start out with a pea sized amount and if you need to go up(which you shouldn't) DO NOT ADD TOO MUCH! I paid less for this than Cetaphil, so the price makes me super happy and it will last just as long. **Open your pores with hot water but rinse with cooler water. Pat dry.

product: ANUA Heartleaf Quercetinol Pore Deep Cleansing Foam, Facial Cleanser, for Double Cleansing, BHA, Hyaluronic Acid, Glycerin, Face Wash, Blackhead Remover, Korean Skincare, 150ml/5.07 fl.oz.
review: I just finished my first tube of this face wash, and its been a year. I have loved it. It doesnt take very much to make plenty of foam. Ive seen a huge decrease in blackheads. My face always feels soft after I use it. The only downside I have found is the tube it comes in. As you use more of the product the harder to get out of tube. I had to start cutting the bottom of the tube to get what was still in there. If I hadnt done that there would have been a huge waste. I am going to order another tube knowing this, because I really liked the face wash.

product: ANUA Heartleaf Quercetinol Pore Deep Cleansing Foam, Facial Cleanser, for Double Cleansing, BHA, Hyaluronic Acid, Glycerin, Face Wash, Blackhead Remover, Korean Skincare, 150ml/5.07 fl.oz.
review: I have purchased this multiple times now and I don't know if I will ever go back. Originally I found it because of some random TikTok Influencer but the hype was real for a reason. I use this paired with their oil based cleanser and the pair really does make such a significant difference in the texture of my skin. When I was traveling and couldn't use it, I could feel the difference when I wasn't using it anymore. I couldn't recommend this stuff more!

product: ANUA Heartleaf Quercetinol Pore Deep Cleansing Foam, Facial Cleanser, for Double Cleansing, BHA, Hyaluronic Acid, Glycerin, Face Wash, Blackhead Remover, Korean Skincare, 150ml/5.07 fl.oz.
review: Im years old. Ive struggled with blackheads and sebaceous filaments since hitting puberty. My skin is red, oily, large pores, and its like almost every pore is clogged. Ive fought this for years and spent a lot of money on different cleansers. Ive bought pretty much every product I could find for oily skin from clean and clear to la roche posay and Paulas choice. This product is amazing!!!!! Usually within an hour or two after washing my face it already starts feeling oily and gross. Ive used it for two days now and can already see and feel a HUGE difference. My skin is super smooth, I dont feel like I need to wash my face again hours after I use it, I can already see less inflammation. For once in a loooong time I feel like I have normal skin. If you have a skin type like mine please try this!!! Its been huge for me because I had pretty much given up hope on my skin until this point.

product: ANUA Heartleaf Quercetinol Pore Deep Cleansing Foam, Facial Cleanser, for Double Cleansing, BHA, Hyaluronic Acid, Glycerin, Face Wash, Blackhead Remover, Korean Skincare, 150ml/5.07 fl.oz.

Sooo when I don't already have irritation on my skin by these activities, I use this and my skin feels more even and soft. I recommend to you and don't use it every day the first time as the AHA BHA can be a bit irritating at first. Also, I recommend this for night routine than morning routine personally.

product: Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser 1000ml, Face & Body, Suitable for All Skin Types, pH balanced, Soap and Fragrance Free, Contains Niacinamide, Dermatologically Tested.
review: This cleanser is a staple in my routine - super gentle, non-irritating, and keeps my skin feeling clean without drying it out. Perfect for both face and body, especially if you have sensitive skin. What I liked: Fragrance-free and super gentle - great for sensitive skin. Doesnt strip moisture but still cleans well. Works on both face and body, so its versatile. Huge L bottle lasts ages - good value for money. What I didnt like: Doesnt foam, so it might feel different if youre used to bubbly cleansers. Might not remove heavy makeup completely - best paired with a makeup remover. If you need a no-fuss, gentle cleanser that works for daily use, this ones a winner!

product: Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser 1000ml, Face & Body, Suitable for All Skin Types, pH balanced, Soap and Fragrance Free, Contains Niacinamide, Dermatologically Tested.

product: Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser 1000ml, Face & Body, Suitable for All Skin Types, pH balanced, Soap and Fragrance Free, Contains Niacinamide, Dermatologically Tested.
review: My Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser (L) arrived on time and was in good condition (now, mostly used). Thank you Amazon (Au) for same day dispatch and Amazon Logistics for a fast, personal and safe delivery. My face began to feel tight and hard as though it had been starched after using my usual cleanser, for some time. I knew that I needed to change to another more gentle cleanser. I tried using a little Sorbolene cream, but found that its oily / greasy character required extensive rinsing. Very inconvenient. Luckily, Amazon had Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser on a deal. So I tried it. Cetaphil Gentle Skin Cleanser has a smooth consistency. It doesn't feel oily or greasy (unlike sorbolene). Cetaphil has the viscosity of a lotion. It is easily spread over the skin, leaving it well coated. There is little wastage from dripping / falling off the skin like some other thicker cleansers. It can be readily washed or wiped off the skin. Personally, l like to apply my cleanser to damp / wet skin. Upon use, I found Cetaphil to be a soothing, non irritating cleanser that left my face feeling clean and refreshed, without any skin tightness. What a relief from the worry of trying to find a suitable cleanser for a reasonable price. An effective cleanser that leaves the natural oils / fats necessary for good skin health, whilst leaving the skin feeling clean.

review: I had stocked up on the old formula of Cetaphil before they changed it in . This is the first time I've bought the new formula cleanser - and I am allergic to it. I came out with contact dermatitis on my neck, under my eye, and on both eyelids. Contact dermatitis is extremely painful and horrible to experience. The skin underneath my eye and my cheekbone area was swollen for over a month while I tried to get it under control. I do not recommend this product, and I am very disappointed that a brand that is supposed to be for sensitive skin is now unsuitable. Disappointing!

product: Round Lab 1025 Dokdo Cleanser 150ml
review: I have very sensitive skin that breaks out super easily and leans more on the dry side. It's been difficult to find a face wash I can use everyday that didn't dry out or irritate my face. From the top of my head I've tried the face shop foaming cleanser, cetaphil, olehenrikson, and kiehls (latest), and they all had varying problems. Kiehl's made my skin a bit better, but it wasn't something I was able to use everyday as it dried it out too much. This is the only cleanser so far that I can use twice a day which doesn't leave my skin feeling overly tight, have dry spots, make my face red/itchy, or break out in skin colored bumps. My face normally can't stand using a face wash twice a day (or even washing twice a day), however it tolerates this one. It doesn't have a very distracting scent (its very slight) and cleans my skin adequately. It feels fresh, clean, and gentle. It's a bit hard to squeeze out of the bottle, but you don't need to use so much anyway and it lathers easily enough. I'm really happy I finally found something that doesn't make my skin angry.

review: -Gentle cleanser that doesn't irritate my sensitive combination skin -Truly unscented -Leaves skin feeling soft and clean -Effective at removing basic makeup and makeup-removing oils. product: Round Lab 1025 Dokdo Cleanser 150ml
review: The **ROUND LAB DOKDO Facial Cleanser** is a great option for anyone looking for a gentle yet effective daily cleanser. Heres a review: . **Gentle Formula**: This facial cleanser is known for its mildness, making it suitable for various skin types, including sensitive skin. The formula is gentle enough for daily use, helping to remove dirt, oil, and impurities without stripping the skin or causing irritation. . **Key Ingredients**: The product features **Dokdo Water**, sourced from the pristine Dokdo Island in South Korea, which is rich in minerals and has soothing properties. This helps hydrate the skin while cleansing, leaving your face feeling fresh and balanced. . **Texture**: The cleanser has a smooth, slightly gel-like consistency that lathers well and feels light on the skin. It doesnt leave any residue behind and doesnt feel tight or dry after use, which is a big plus for those with dry or sensitive skin. . **Fragrance**: The product has a very subtle, fresh scent that isnt overpowering, making it suitable for those who prefer fragrance-free or lightly scented skincare products. . **Packaging**: The ml (. fl.oz) size is compact and easy to use, with a convenient flip-top cap for dispensing the product. It's a good size for both daily use and travel. **Overall**: The ROUND LAB DOKDO Facial Cleanser offers a refreshing, hydrating cleanse without being harsh on the skin. If you're looking for a gentle, mineral-rich cleanser that cleanses and nourishes, this one is worth trying!

review: This cleanser is meant to be non-drying, but it was still a bit drying on my skin. I have combo skin that's dry immediately after cleansing, but then gets oily in the t-zone throughout the day. I normally use non- or low-foaming cleansers with pH .-ish as they're not drying after I finish cleansing. Social media got me to try this cleanser since so many people were claiming it was foamy, but non-drying. While it is definitely very foamy, with a thick, velvety foam, it was drying on my skin. I use it as a second cleanser after an oil cleanser and it seems to work well as a second cleanser. It has a faintest plasticky scent which does not bother me. While it's not an ideal cleanser for my preference, I'll continue to use it up.

BUT!This type of cream cleaners that make foam, almost all, dry out the skin and it is important to quickly apply the moisturizer after using it. I do not recommend it for very dry or trend.

product: Round Lab 1025 Dokdo Cleanser 150ml
review: I am in LOVE with this cleanser! I usually use ROUND LAB's birch juice cleanser, but I wanted to try something new. This did not disappoint! Packaging: On point. Super cute, yet simple. There are instructions in English on the unicarton and Korean instructions on the actual product. The ingredients are clearly listed and the produst itself was sealed. Use: Pretty straightforward stuff, wet, lather, and rinse, right? That being said, this cleanser is a bit different. It DOES lather up, but with the addition of deep sea salt, the lather disappates quickly, (So yeah, that picture was taken rather QUICKLY) but of course, a little more water, and you're good to go! As with most ROUND LAB products, a little really does go a long way, so you really don't need to use a ton of product to get the good results! The formula is nice and soft, easy on, easy off and... it's hard to explain, but after rinsing, my face did "dry down" but it wasn't "dry-dry" (I hope that makes sense!) Notes: One thing I did notice that isn't a detractor or anything, is that the Sea Salt DOES act as a micro-exfoliant. So definitely be aware of that if you're sensitive to those sorts of things. I do believe it's safe to use for daily use, though, I won't personally be using it during my nighttime routine, just my morning one. (I'm also not a professional, so take that with a grain of Deep Sea Salt!) Overall: Round Lab has done it again! And for someone with Oily/Combo skin, this, paired with the rest of their line (and other K-beauty skin products) keep my face happy and clean!

product: COSRX Salicylic Acid Daily Gentle Cleanser, 150ml, Pack of 1
review: Here we have the Salicylic acid daily gentle cleansers by Cosrx. (Korean brand) This cleanser obvious key ingredient is .% Salicylic Acid, Laurie Acid, Teatree leaf oil, Salicylic Alba Bark Water and Glycerine. This is design to melt away impurities, it gently removes dirt, excess oil and product build up whilst replenishing moisture. This leaves your skin feeling soft, visibly clearer and boast your skins natural glow. My experience- my skin type is dry/sensitive This has a white thick gel like texture, also has a teatree/willow scent to it. It is easy to lather up with water and form into foam texture. I like to ensure my face is damp before I use this and and once again use this as a foam. I generally gently rub this around my face for about min before rising off. I find this allows time for the product to work. With my skin type I can not use this daily, as I find it too stripping. I will gently use this once or twice a week depending on the condition of my skin. ( please note if this is drying your skin out and cause a break out, please stop and give it as rest as you are over using the product and breaking your skin barrier)

product: COSRX Salicylic Acid Daily Gentle Cleanser, 150ml, Pack of 1
review: I purchased this product as it was finally a facial cleanser with salicylic acid available in Australia for a reasonable price. I did not expect the near on instantaneous affects of this great cleanser. I have struggled with moderate acne for the past few years, and have tried nearly every available drug store cleanser, toner, exfoliator etc. I had heard about the benefits of salicylic acid for acne prone skin, and looked into cleansers. Many were extremely expensive, or were only available in the US. I'm so glad I found this cleanser. I've now been using it for a month alongside my minocycline acne pills (lower level accutane like drug), and have found amazing benefits. -reduced redness -less swelling -smaller breakouts -less common breakouts -less oily skin -reduced appearance of sebaceous filaments Would definitely recommend this cleanser if you struggle with oily skin and acne.

product: La Roche Posay Anti-Acne Cleanser, Purifying Foaming Gel, Cleanser For Oily Skin, Soap-Free and Paraben-Free, Effaclar, 200ml
review: For a few months now I () have been suffering from a somewhat shiny and pimple -tending skin, although I never had skin problems before.Probably due to stress. Coincidentally, I got to a rehearsal of this washing gel and I liked it incredibly very much when I used it for the first time.Usually my skin tenses very much after using a washing gel and does not feel good, which forced me to apply cream and that has only worsened the shine of the skin.As a result, I only used a washing gel every few days in the morning. The Effaclar, on the other hand, does not dry out the skin at all, thanks to the pH-neutral consistency.Applying is no longer absolutely necessary after use - the skin feels fresh and gently cleaned.I have used it about - times so far. The most important thing - and I absolutely cannot understand how some ladies and gentlemen can deny it!- I have had no shiny skin since the first application.The pimples have almost disappeared.In the morning I see a little red dot in the mirror, but you can't call it a pimple. I can absolutely recommend it to anyone who also suffers from a somewhat greasy (post -pubescent) skin!The money is definitely worth it!:-) PS: I use the facial cleaning brush from Olaz.Also recommended warmly!

product: La Roche Posay Anti-Acne Cleanser, Purifying Foaming Gel, Cleanser For Oily Skin, Soap-Free and Paraben-Free, Effaclar, 200ml
review: La Roche-Posay's face wash stands out as a refreshing and gentle option for daily skincare routines. Having incorporated it into my regimen, I've found several aspects of the product to be commendable. Firstly, its gentle formulation is a standout feature. Suitable for sensitive skin, it cleanses effectively without causing irritation or dryness, making it a reliable choice for daily use. The absence of harsh ingredients ensures a soothing experience, particularly for those prone to sensitivity or redness. Moreover, the face wash's effectiveness in removing impurities and excess oil is noteworthy. Despite its mild nature, it lathers well and effectively cleanses the skin without stripping away its natural moisture barrier. This leaves the skin feeling clean, refreshed, and balanced after each use. Additionally, the inclusion of La Roche-Posay's signature Thermal Spring Water adds an extra layer of hydration and comfort to the cleansing experience. This unique ingredient helps to soothe and soften the skin, contributing to a refreshed and revitalized complexion. The packaging is practical and user-friendly, with a convenient pump dispenser that ensures easy and mess-free application. The product's dermatologist-tested and fragrance-free formula further adds to its appeal, making it suitable for a wide range of skin types, including those with sensitivities or allergies. However, while the face wash excels in cleansing and soothing the skin, it may not be the most effective option for removing heavy makeup or waterproof products. In such cases, a double cleanse or additional makeup remover may be necessary. In summary, La Roche-Posay's face wash is a reliable and gentle cleanser that effectively cleanses the skin without compromising its delicate balance. Suitable for daily use, it offers a refreshing and soothing experience, making it a staple in any skincare routine.

review: Hello:) I have been struggling with severe skin problems for years because I sweat a lot due to a thyroid overactive.That's why I had to deal with pimples all over the body, which have often become very inflamed.I have tried several creams and products for years.Nothing helped.Until I came across this product through the advice of a pharmacist.This shower gel disinfects the skin without stimulating the skin.A different feeling of skin is noticeable after first use.It also reduces fat and sebum formation in the skin.Development of new pikels is greatly reduced.And the wound healing of inflamed areas is strongly stimulated.Since the beginning of this shower gel, I have almost no problems with my skin.You have a whole new attitude to life.I am sure that it doesn't help everyone uses this product.But with certainty, it will help some to get your skin problems under control.Pharmacies offer free product samples to try out.Have fun trying it out !!!I don't want to do without !!!

product: La Roche Posay Anti-Acne Cleanser, Purifying Foaming Gel, Cleanser For Oily Skin, Soap-Free and Paraben-Free, Effaclar, 200ml
review: I have combination to oily skin. Before using La Roche Posay, I had bumps all over my forehead because of my bangs (which I've had for over years) and I got so disgusted looking at my forehead I needed to do something about it and invest in a good cleanser that was inexpensive. I used to use St. Ives, Clean and Clear, and Neutrogena then my friend let me try some of her La Roche Posay products and I absolutely loved it and bought this cleanser ASAP. After using this cleanser for about two weeks I noticed a difference in my skin and it was clearing up (especially my forehead). I was happy with my purchase. It's super gentle on my sensitive skin and the product lasts a long time. After three months of using this product I found out what works for me. Some tips and tricks with using this product - Know your skin type!!! - Remove any makeup before washing your face - rinse your face with warm water and wash the cleanser off with warm water. After washing, splash your face with COLD water - Make sure to activate the product in your hands before applying it on the face, don't apply it directly after taking the product out - wash your face for a sold minute and a half to ensure a good cleansing - ALWAYS MOISTURIZE RIGHT AFTER CLEANSING OR CONTINUE WITH YOUR SKIN CARE ROUTINE - If you're more combo than oily, only use this cleanser once a day or else it will dry our your skin. If you want to cleanse twice a day, invest in a lighter formula of this cleanser. If you don't moisturize right after or continue with your skin care routine, you won't notice a visible difference. Always hydrate the skin after cleansing. If you're looking for immediate results, this might not be your product. For me with most products, I notice a difference after consistent uses up to two weeks. Patience is key with trying new skin care products because your skin needs to get used to what you're putting on it. Knowing your skin type helps a lot too with finding cleansers and products that will suit your skin needs. Overall, this cleanser from La Roche Posay works for me and I absolutely love the results from it. If you're not into scents or smells, this product has a very light scent. Not fruity, or strong just smells refreshing.

product: La Roche Posay Anti-Acne Cleanser, Purifying Foaming Gel, Cleanser For Oily Skin, Soap-Free and Paraben-Free, Effaclar, 200ml
review: I bought this face wash in hopes of clearing up a lot of unsightly blemishes... it did just that, for the most part. When first opening the bottle, I was really put off by how fragranced the gel wash is. It's not a bad smell (very perfume-y), but highly fragranced face washes tend to dry my skin out (which it did eventually). For the first month and a half, I used this with an exfoliating battery operated facial brush since my skin doesn't self-exfoliate very well. It worked okay with getting make up and everything, but I was still breaking out a lot. I kept using the wash but opted to use it sans-facial brush. This seemed to work a lot better, and didn't dry my face out as much. For about another months, my skin was pretty great. Until the colder weather came around and it sucked any remaining moisture out of my skin. Basically - it's a nice facial cleanser for the warmer months. It's good for getting makeup and sweat/oil off, but does tend to dry my combination skin out.

product: La Roche Posay Anti-Acne Cleanser, Purifying Foaming Gel, Cleanser For Oily Skin, Soap-Free and Paraben-Free, Effaclar, 200ml
review: My little story for those who are interested: I have been suffering from impure skin for about my th year.My back, cleavage and my face were totally greasy and covered with many pimples.Unfortunately I was young and naive and due to very lack of hygiene I didn't take care of it, unfortunately my mother wasn't.At the age of I thought about it and looked at which skin type I correspond.Unfortunately I always typed on dry skin, it was totally wrong.Accordingly, I also bought products for dry or combination skin, which of course only led to the fact that my skin dried out extremely and I then produced more sebum, my pores clogged and of course I got more pimples.So as you can see, I was very stupid. I tried a lot of products from drugstores and everyone is somehow shit, especially there are only products for dry, very dry or combination skin.I then made myself smart on the Internet and found that I was suffering from greasy skin, so I started looking for products. About the product: I came across La Roche-Posay and read a lot about it.It was very convincing me so I bought the cleaning gel, a cream, a peeling and an anti-pimple cream.You have to say something went on the money (approx. ) but I assure you it was extremely worth it.I have had the products for a week and I see more and more difference every day.Sure, it always takes time, but you notice a very good result in time.As I said, I had to do with many products and it usually only worsened the result.It is very pleasant, it smells good and the skin does not grease, I use the gel in the morning and in the evening and then also the anti-pimple cream. My little tip: I am very convinced and can really recommend it who suffers from greasy/oily skin with improve and pimples. Please check first of which skin type you have since you put the wrong products.If nothing helps you, a visit to the skin doctor is necessary, especially for people who suffer from acne, let yourself be examined regularly, it is not to be trifled with it and pay attention to how you eat, so a McDonald's visit is better to avoid, or chips and other sweets.

product: Paula's Choice CLEAR Pore Normalizing Cleanser, Salicylic Acid Face Wash for Blemishes, Blackheads, Large Pores & Redness, 177 mL
review: As a long -time customer of Paula's Choice, I am enthusiastic about this excellent cleaning gel again.The Clear facial cleaner is a real all-rounder that not only removes make-up, but also acts against impurities and reduces excess sebum. The best thing about this product, however, is that it is gently to the skin and at the same time is very effective against pimples and other impurities.The active ingredient salicylic acid is a real miracle cure against blackheads and other skin problems.The cleaning gel leaves my skin refreshed and maintained without it feeling dry or irritated. I was particularly impressed by the effect of panthenol / vitamin B.It stores moisture and significantly improves the appearance of my skin.I noticed that my skin feels smoother and radiant since I used this cleaner. The application is very simple and quick.I moisten my face with lukewarm water and then distribute a hazelnut -sized amount of the cleaner on my fingertips.I gently massage it into my face with circular movements and around my eyes before I wash it down thoroughly. The best thing about this cleaner is that it is suitable for all skin types, even for sensitive and dry skin.The gel contains no sharp ingredients and is water -soluble.It does not dry out my skin and is perfect for facial cleaning in the shower or in the bathtub. I am also very happy that all Paula's Choice products are perfume -free and are never tested on animals.That gives me a good feeling and I can use the products with a clear conscience. In summary, I can only say that the Clear facial cleaner from Paula's Choice is an absolute top product.It is effective, gently with the skin and for all skin types.I can recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable cleaner who fights impurities and pimples and at the same time maintains the skin.

product: CeraVe Blemish Control Cleanser Gel Face Wash For Blackheads, Blocked Pores & Acne-prone Skin, 2% Salicylic Acid + Niacinamide + Purifying Clay + Ceramides, Lightweight + Oil-Absorbing, 236ml
review: I have been using the Cleanser control clea and honestly for a while, it has been a positive change in my skin care routine.As someone who fights with imperfections and excess fat, I am always looking for products that keep my skin clean without resecting it.This cleaner has pleasantly surprised me, and here I explain why. Deep and soft cleaning Something that I loved from this product is how it gets a deep cleaning without leaving dry skin or strap.I have tried other acne cleaners, but many of them are usually quite aggressive.Instead, the Cerave cleaner manages to clean the pores and control the sebum without causing irritation.After using it, I feel fresh and clean skin, but I don't have that uncomfortable feeling of extreme dryness.It is a difficult balance to find in acneic skins, and here I think they have succeeded. Active ingredients and their benefits This cleaner has a combination of ingredients that works very well.One of the main ones is salicylic acid, which is ideal for disobstructing pores and preventing new outbreaks.Being a chemical exfoliant, I do not need to use physical scrubs that can be too abrasive.I feel that salicylic acid helps me keep my skin clean and with fewer black points, something that is always a challenge. In addition, it has niacinamide, which is an ingredient that I like a lot.Niacinamide helps to calm the skin and reduce redness, which is perfect if you have acne and a bit irritated skin.It also regulates excess fat, so I have noticed that my skin is less bright throughout the day. Finally, something that seems to me a strong point is the ceramids.They are lipids that help maintain intact skin barrier, and this is crucial in cleaning products.Many times, acne products can damage the cutaneous barrier and leave the skin more vulnerable, but thanks to ceramides, I notice that this cleaner is more respectful and keep my skin balanced. Texture and feeling when using it The texture is another aspect that I like.It is a gel that rubbing it on the face becomes a light foam.It is not too foamy, which I appreciate because I feel that it is distributed well without being abrasive.After rinsing it, I notice that my skin feels very fresh and with a deep cleaning, but without that strap sensation that some cleaners leave. Results that I have noticed With regular use, I have seen improvements in my skin.The outbreaks are less frequent and when they appear, they are less severe.I also feel that the texture of my skin is softer and more uniform, probably due to the effect of chemical exfoliation of salicylic acid.I like that it is a product that I can use every day without worrying that the skin would dry out or irritate. Ideal for my skin type Although this cleaner is designed for skin with acneic tendency, I think it works well for various skin types, especially if you have mixed or fat.My skin is mixed and I usually have excess fat problems in the T zone, but with this cleaner I notice that sebum control is effective.Even if you have sensitive skin, I think it would work well because it is quite soft and has soothing ingredients. Quality-price ratio As for the quantity, the container brings ml, which seems quite generous.I need very little product every time I use it, so a bottle lasts a lot.Considering the quality of the ingredients and the results I get, I think it has an excellent value for money.In addition, Cerave is a brand known for its effective and soft formulas, so I have confidence in its products.

product: CeraVe Blemish Control Cleanser Gel Face Wash For Blackheads, Blocked Pores & Acne-prone Skin, 2% Salicylic Acid + Niacinamide + Purifying Clay + Ceramides, Lightweight + Oil-Absorbing, 236ml
review: I started using this Cera detergent about two weeks ago, hoping to improve my skin that tends to be oily with some imperfection here and there.I immediately liked the fact that it had no strong or annoying perfumes: it is very delicate on the skin, even if it contains salicylic acid. After the first few days, I noticed that the skin seemed cleaner and less shiny, especially in the T area. It does not make immediate miracles (do not expect to wake up with the perfect skin from one day to the next), but with constant use you can see improvements.It seems to me that the pores are less evident and that imperfections dry faster. The texture is interesting: a gel that does not make a lot of foam, but that rinses easily without leaving residues.And the purifying clay is a nice touch, because it does not dry the skin as I thought, which I appreciate very much since my skin is mixed and sometimes sensitive. The only thing is that, if you use it too often or without moisturizing well after, it can leave the skin a little pulled.I use it once a day, in the evening, and so far it is going very well. Points in favor: Check the lucidity well and leave the skin clean. It does not irritate, despite the active ingredients. Perfect for mixed or fat skin. Points to improve: The package is a little small for the price, but it takes little. Better to use it together with a good moisturizing cream to avoid dryness. In general, it is a product that I recommend to those who want to take care of the skin without complicating their lives too much.Just have a little patience to see the results!

product: CeraVe Blemish Control Cleanser Gel Face Wash For Blackheads, Blocked Pores & Acne-prone Skin, 2% Salicylic Acid + Niacinamide + Purifying Clay + Ceramides, Lightweight + Oil-Absorbing, 236ml
review: I recently had the opportunity to test this product for me and I am really impressed by its results! With its key ingredients such as salicylic acid, white clay, niacinamide, hyaluronic acid and essential ceramids, it offers everything I was looking for for a washing face! First of all, salicylic acid acts gently to exfoliate and smooth the skin, while unconstructing the pores.White clay effectively purifies the skin and helps reduce excess sebum, which is ideal for people struggling with acne problems. The presence of niacinamide in this product is really appreciated, because it offers an anti-inflammatory action that soothes the skin and reduces redness (unlike certain brands with aggressive soap).In addition, hyaluronic acid hydrates deeply, leaving the skin soft and flexible (more dry skin!). What I particularly liked was that this product manages to remove impurities from the skin without drying it.This is essential to prevent the appearance of pimples and maintain an optimal balance of skin hydration.However, I recommend using it once twice a day for better results, because too much use produces the opposite effect!(It is not by cleaning the skin several times a day that you will reduce the acne, you must clean it in the morning and in the evening - for my part only in the evening because I do not have very oily skin) Finally, what seduced me in this product is to be able to find everything you need to limit acne without having to buy lots of product without advised skincare.I couldn't have several products anymore and I finally found what suited me.No longer clean your skin with Marseille soap hoping to remove the sebum, take this soap instead :)

review: I have really awkward skin - eczema on my eyelids, dry skin all over my face, but spot prone around my chin (thanks to endometriosis). I have been using this face wash alongside the cerave oil free spf day moisturiser, cerave retinol serum, and cerave oil free night moisturiser for a couple of months now and my skin seems the best it has in ages. Takes off makeup fairly easily (sometimes I have to double wash to remove all mascara or dark lipstick). No smell. Does not irritate my eczema or dry skin. Leaves my skin feeling clean. No skin burns to my cheeks (which I am really prone to due to my sensitive skin!) Good size bottle and pump is still working well. Will be re-purchasing when I run out but still have loads left.

product: Sukin Foaming Facial Cleanser, Signature, 125 ml
review: This is my first ever Amazon review but I just had to write it because Sukin deserves all the positive reviews. I have been using Sukin products for around two years now so I've really given them the test of time. I use three products religiously: the Micellar Cleansing Water, the signature Facial Moisturiser, and this foaming facial cleanser. They are all equally excellent and are the only skincare products I use at all. Throughout my life I have been prone to breakouts and extremely sensitive skin. If I ever try and switch out my skincare and try other products, it immediately breaks out. Sukin is the only brand that my skin has ever responded well to, and my skin has never become 'bored' of it so to speak, it has produced consistently good results for the entire two years I have been using it. This cleanser removes makeup SO well, I just use it in the shower and scrub it onto a face full of makeup and it removes EVERYTHING, including stubborn mascara and eyeliner - just make sure you rub it in and make it nice and foamy. It is honestly amazing and leaves my skin feeling fresh, clean and healthy. I would recommend all Sukin products always.

product: Sukin Foaming Facial Cleanser, Signature, 125 ml
review: The Sukin Foaming Facial Cleanser provides a refreshing and gentle cleansing experience. Initially, I enjoyed using it daily, appreciating its ability to effectively remove dirt and impurities without drying out my skin as much as some cleansers do. However, only a day after my first use I noticed a minor reaction of flakiness around my eyes and nose. This was most likely from one of the ingredients as this has happened to me before. This may only be a rare issue but if you have sensitive skin I recommend patch testing it a day before use. Despite this reaction, I recognize that skincare products can vary in their effects from person to person. While the Sukin Foaming Facial Cleanser may not have been suitable for my skin, it still offers effective cleansing properties and natural ingredients that may benefit others.

product: Sukin Foaming Facial Cleanser, Signature, 125 ml
review: This is not what I expected. Firstly, this not a foam. It is a liquid gel that you pump out of the bottle and have to add water to in order for it to foam up. The smell isn't great. When I opened the bottle and took the pump out, it did smell like lemon meringue as another reviewer had stated. But when, actually pumped out and added to water, the smell changes for some bizarre reason and isn't great. It was more expensive than other brands for the same amount, so not economical. I bought this as my usual brand is unavailable, so I thought I would give this a try as it stated is was a FOAM cleanser. The description is very misleading. A foam cleanser should be foam as it is pumped out of the bottle. This is just a liquid soap. The manufacturer should take note that for it to be a foam cleanser, you need a foaming pump to convert the liquid into foam. The pump provided is not the correct pump for converting the liquid into a foam. Sort it out. I would not recommend this, due to the false advertising of the product.

product: Sukin Foaming Facial Cleanser, Signature, 125 ml
review: I have tried many cleansers/face washes and after a while my skin would get irritated by them and I would have to start over finding a new wash that won't affect my skin. This is now my go-to, have been using this consistently for almost a year and it leaves my skin feeling fresh, clear, without irritation. The smell is lush but not overpowering - I don't believe they put in any additional fragrances and rely on the ingredients already in it. I think I've used it for long enough to write a review, and overall it's a glowing one.

product: Sukin Foaming Facial Cleanser, Signature, 125 ml
review: Talking of the scent first. It smells just like lemon meringue pie, nice if you are going to eat a pudding but a little too sickly for me. As a face wash it is good but needs a lot of rinsing however small a dot you use. That said it really lathers well and what looks like small bottle lasts for ages. I am quite happy to finish it as my skin is happy enough. I have tried others not nearly as good with less value for money. The choice I have to make in a couple of weeks is whether to re-buy this brand or go back to another of my other favourites with virtually no scent.

product: Thayers pH Balancing Daily Cleanser, Face Wash with Aloe Vera, Gentle and Hydrating Skin Care for Dry, Oily, or Acne Prone Skin, 8 FL Oz.
review: Thayers facial cleansing with Aloe Vera is a product that adapts perfectly to those with dry, oily or mixed skin, and looks for a delicate but effective detergent. The presence of Aloe Vera makes it particularly moisturizing, while its light and non -aggressive formula is ideal for daily use. One of the characteristics that struck me most is the ability to cleanse without leaving the skin dry or tense, as often happens with other detergents. After application, the face is fresh and clean, without that feeling of "pit skin", which is a common problem for those with dry or sensitive skin. For those with oily skin, it helps to adjust the excess of sebum without depriving the skin of its natural hydration. The consistency is creamy and pleasant, and a small amount is enough to obtain a good foam.Aloe vera has a calming effect that reduces any redness or irritation, making it suitable also for those with more reactive skin or with acne trends. After several weeks of use, I noticed that my skin appears more balanced, with less lucidity in the T area and a general improvement in appearance. It is an excellent detergent for those looking for a versatile product, capable of hydrating and purifying at the same time, without attacking the skin. In conclusion, the face cleansing Thayers with Aloe Vera is a perfect lotion for those who want a delicate, moisturizing product and suitable for all skin types, with a natural formulation that do not compromise the effectiveness of daily cleansing.

review: I've only used it for a couple of days now but absolutely fell in love with it. The skin feels so much smoother and cleaner but at the same time the product doesn't dry the skin. I've been using it for months and it's still gonna last for over a year, so it's well worth the price. I did wait for it to go on sale before I bought it, so I'm pleased with my purchase. review: I bought this cleanser after reading reviews and trusting that it's good on sensitive skin. I found it to be drying on my skin just as much as a soap bar would do. My usual go to face wash is Nivea for combination skin with ph balancing properties and it has worked as required on my skin for years meaning, does not leave skin too greasy in Summers and doesn't leave skin too dry in winter months. The positives for Thayer's is that a tiny bit goes a long way and is unscented. This bottle would easily last me longer than months. Overall it's good.

review: This product is great, my wife uses it a lot. This is my third time purchasing it here however, I'm in the process of returning it. It usually arrives with a branded tape securing the nozzle. While it doesn't smell as good as Maapilim's face cleanser did, it's the only product I've come across since that has felt the best on my skin and provided the most consistent results for my face. Plus, I really like that they have aloe vera in the cleanser formula and that the bottle itself has a pump dispenser as well. Those were a big plus in my book!

review: This has Sodium Lauryl Sulfate (SLS), so I don't really like it. The highest risk of using products with SLS and SLES is irritation to your eyes, skin, mouth, and lungs. For people with sensitive skin, sulfates may also clog pores and cause acne.

product: THEFACESHOP Rice Water Bright Foam Cleanser 150ml
review: Pleasantly surprised. I was looking for an alternative to the checks & balances frothy foam cleanser. Had tried a few foaming cleaners from stores that ended up either too creamy, not enough froth or sud, broke put skin, etc. Decided to try this based on reviews. It foams up nicely. Only small amount of product needed so should last a long time (I recommend gently squeezing out only a small pee size. This product cleaned my face well. Cleared up much of the breakouts from all the other products I tried. Rinsed well. Has a scent but not overpowering & did not bother my skin. I use this sometimes alone & sometimes with a buffing face pad/or wash cloth for exfoliation. It cleaned my pores without overdrying my skin. My only regret is that I did not try this years ago when it st came out. I will definitely continue to use this product. Oh, and the tube is huge! For reference, I'm grandma age but this also works well for the young adults as well. Probably would e good for a teen with acne too as it cleans well without stripping & overdrying skin which in turn if that happens, skin produces more oil to make up for it. Try it. What do you have to lose.

review: Very gentle cleansing foam. My sensitive skin loves it. It cleanses without leaving the skin dry or irritated. After using it, my skin is so soft, smooth and even. My go-to cleanser for many years now.

product: THEFACESHOP Rice Water Bright Foam Cleanser 150ml
review: I have been using this Face Shop Rice Water Bright Foaming Facial Cleanser, and I absolutely love it! This face wash provides a deep and thorough cleanse, removing dirt, oil, and impurities from my skin while still being gentle and non-irritating. One of the things I appreciate the most is how it helps reduce the appearance of pores, giving my skin a smoother and more refined look. Additionally, this cleanser is highly hydrating and moisturizing, ensuring that my skin feels soft and nourished after each wash. Unlike many other cleansers that can leave the skin feeling tight or dry, this one maintains the perfect balance of cleansing and hydration. It is mild and suitable for daily use, making it an excellent choice for anyone who wants a cleanser that is both effective and gentle. I have always loved rice-based skincare products, as they work exceptionally well for my skin type and consistently deliver amazing results. This cleanser is no exception! It comes in a generously sized pack that lasts for months, making it cost-effective and worth every penny. I use it twice a day, every single day, and my skin has been benefiting greatly from it. Overall, I am extremely happy with this product and would highly recommend it to my friends and family. If you're looking for a cleanser that cleans deeply, minimizes pores, hydrates well, and lasts long, this is worth trying!

review: After using minimalist oat extract face wash for about a month, Im extremely satisfied with my experience. Pros: - Gentle on the skin, doesnt make it dry - Skin feels clean despite not making any lather - Doesnt contain any fragrance which shows they havent added any artificial, unnatural fragrances in the product - True to their name, their packing is also minimal which is great to see. Other than the product container which is plastic, there is no other plastic used at all in the packaging which is fantastic Cons: - Slightly expensive but worth it. Else, I would say no cons so far Points to note: - It doesnt form any lather - It doesnt have any fragrance Overall experience: Definitely recommend this product to those with dry/sensitive skin and those looking for a product with minimal chemicals. To my dry skin, it has given a decent all-weather face wash option. I hope they come up with a larger bottle as well Tips for other buyers: As it doesn't form any lather, it will get some time to get used to it and to know how much quantity to use. review: Im going to try to be as honest as possible because I am peeved at the same time understand that things happen. Upon opening my Amazon package, I found that half of my cleanser had spilled into the box, making it soggy and also obviously wasting half of the product. The product itself is lovely. I have combination skin that leans dry, so I need a cleanser that is thorough but doesnt dry out. So far after my first two uses, this seems to be it. My skin feels clean but I dont have that tightness or dryness that I do with harsher cleansers. I dont feel like I need to run for moisturizer immediately after and I cant see my pores as prominently. That being said, my only customer service option was to return the defective item to Amazon. For $., this seems excessive to me and quite frankly more trouble (for myself and the environment) than just taking the L. So product gets / so far, Amazon third-party seller customer service gets / stars.

product: Torriden DIVE IN Cleansing Foam Face Wash 150ml (5.07 fl.oz.) | Hydrating Daily Facial Cleanser for All and Sensitive Skin | Hyaluronic Acid, Panthenol, Allantoin
review: This product provides a deep, thorough cleanse while being incredibly nourishing and moisturizing. Unlike other face washes that leave my skin feeling tight or dry, this one locks in hydration, leaving my skin soft, smooth, and refreshed. The texture is creamy but lightweight, and it lathers just enough to remove dirt, oil, and makeup without stripping my skin. After each use, my face feels clean, balanced, and healthy, with no dryness or irritation. Its perfect for anyone looking for a gentle yet effective cleanser that supports skin hydration. If you need a nourishing face wash that truly cleans without drying your skin, I highly recommend this one!

review: I'm a man in my s with normal to dry skin. I've already used Triden Green face wash, but I was also curious about this so I bought it. The feel of use is as follows. Foam quality You can create a firm foam by removing about -cm and then lathering it with your hands.If you use the internet it might look even more intense.It's almost fragrance-free. You can wash it with air and gently slurp foam, or you can thoroughly whisk it, cover it like a pack, and wash it by pressing the foam. Washing The foam is well-developed and has a refreshing feel, but it doesn't stick, and I get the impression that it still has a moderate moisture content. Since this is the summer season, we will be checking the signs of use in the spring and autumn seasons and dry winter seasons in the future. effect Contains vitamin C to tighten pores!Or, the peeling effect removes dullness!It's not a product that does not have any such features, so I think it would be good for those who want to clean their skin purely. Overall review I have normal skin so I can't help but feel that this kind of product is fine, but I think it's a product that I think isn't bad for anyone who has used it for any age.Oh, and the volume and foaming are very cost-effective. It's a bit of a pain to have multiple face washes, but I think it's recommended as a facial cleanser for everyday use and for skin problems.

product: Paulas Choice SKIN PERFECTING 2% BHA Liquid Salicylic Acid Exfoliant, Daily Facial Exfoliator for Blackheads, Enlarged Pores, Wrinkles & Fine Lines, Fragrance-Free & Paraben-Free, Full Size - 118 ml
review: This is arguably the best exfoliator I've ever used. Normally, I'm a big fan of Korean skincare as it suits my skin better, but this Paula's Choice BHA exfoliator probably beats any other exfoliator I've used. Within week of using this, the blackheads and whiteheads on my nose? GONE! It doesn't even sting your skin like many other acid based exfoliators I've used. I've even tried this where my skin was uneven. Guess what happened? My skin became as smooth as a baby's bottom! I bought the travel size, which is a bit small (size of my palm). However, you only need one drop a day for results, which is how this tiny bottle lasted me months (and counting!) with half the bottle left. The design of the bottle is also secure, with a little flip top inside the white screw top (which is very good for travelling in my experience). To add, I'm a big fan of making my skincare desk aesthetic, and the minimalistic design of this bottle just tops off how good this exfoliator is. Paula's Choice you've done it again! Pros: - Smooths skin - Doesn't sting AT ALL - Gets rid of blackheads / whiteheads - Secure flip top - Aesthetic bottle Cons: - NONE!

product: Paulas Choice SKIN PERFECTING 2% BHA Liquid Salicylic Acid Exfoliant, Daily Facial Exfoliator for Blackheads, Enlarged Pores, Wrinkles & Fine Lines, Fragrance-Free & Paraben-Free, Full Size - 118 ml
review: Paula's Choice Skin Perfecting % BHA Liquid Exfoliant is a must-have for smoother, clearer skin. product: Paulas Choice SKIN PERFECTING 2% BHA Liquid Salicylic Acid Exfoliant, Daily Facial Exfoliator for Blackheads, Enlarged Pores, Wrinkles & Fine Lines, Fragrance-Free & Paraben-Free, Full Size - 118 ml
review: FINALLY a product that actually addresses the stubborn hormonal blackheads and clogged pores I get on my chin that Ive never been able to get rid of! Bye bye deep, sore pimples. I had some small spots of purging after starting to use this, but Im not unhappy about it because it just means its working and the area thats been previously untreatable (my chin) is finallyyyy responding to an exfoliant. Ive found through trial and error that my skin responds much better to BHAs than AHAs. The latter are too harsh and strip my skin which is very sensitive and dry. Ive even been using this product almost every night on my chin, which is much more frequently than I usually use exfoliants but somehow its gentle enough not to have me peeling or red and sensitive. Having said that, I dont think I need to use it this often Im just overexcited about the results. I had other paulas choice products, one with BHA in it and I even used the BHA product for a while but they werent nearly as effective as this formula. I will repurchase this and Im so glad I found it after reading reviews!

product: Paulas Choice SKIN PERFECTING 2% BHA Liquid Salicylic Acid Exfoliant, Daily Facial Exfoliator for Blackheads, Enlarged Pores, Wrinkles & Fine Lines, Fragrance-Free & Paraben-Free, Full Size - 118 ml
review: This is a travel size bottle, but I bought it so I can try it out. This is the best thing I have ever bought for my skin. I've only used it three times, and it has transformed my skin. I'm a brown girl and hence my skin is naturally dull and has random dark spots. But after just two applications my skin has gotten brighter, clearer, and none of my pores are visible anymore. It is quite strong so you shouldn't use it every day, I use it twice a week. I can literally see my dead skin flaking off so you might want to scrub and moisturizer once that happens to you. I am surely buying the bigger bottle as soon as I'm done with this one. FIVE STARS!

review: After seeing rave reviews on social media I decided to try this exfoliant, rather than using a toner. I am so incredibly pleased with this product. It wasnt immediate, but I noticed my acne healing quickly and the scars disappear faster than usual. I dont believe that this can prevent acne (thanks to my hormones for that) but it does a fantastic job of managing it. The instructions are to use it up to twice daily, but I found this dried out my skin (which is weird cuz Im so oily). Instead I use it every two days, and I use my benzoyl peroxide treatment on every other day. With a niacinamide serum this just works so well. The only downside is that it smells a bit weird, like vinegar. Nevertheless I am recommending it to anyone who will listen to me! If you suffer from persistent acne i really think Paulas Choice will help you!!

review: The La Roche-Posay Mela B Gel is an exceptional product for anyone looking to brighten and even out their skin tone. For optimal results, I recommend applying it after cleansing and toning your skin. Start with a pea-sized amount and gently massage it into your face and neck, allowing it to absorb fully before applying your moisturizer or sunscreen. For best results, use it both morning and night. Consistency is key, so incorporating it into your daily routine will help you see improvements over time. Its also essential to use sunscreen during the day, as the ingredients in this gel can make your skin more sensitive to sun exposure. I've noticed a significant difference in my skins clarity and brightness since I started using this gel. It absorbs quickly and doesnt leave any sticky residue, which is a huge plus. Overall, I highly recommend the La Roche-Posay Mela B Gel for anyone looking to enhance their skincare routine!

I have combination skin with hormonal acne on my chin and sensitive skin too. This cleanser has been brilliant, and hasnt made my skin tight, it feels really soft and supple after use. The pump makes it easy to use and it lasts a long time, and its also cheaper than the brand I was using before. Im converted, highly recommend!

review: I felt compelled to leave this review after being so impressed by a travel size bottle, I had to buy a bigger version! I think everyone knows the premium quality of CeraVe face products now with their close focus on ceramides and amino acids. They prove to be a brand of particular relevance by being wonderfully affordable and holding tremendous value. This face wash does everything I fell in love with CeraVe for, from being a gentle yet proactive product. The face wash comes out in a cream form which at first appears similar to some other known brands. The main difference, however, comes through once applied to the face at instantly turns into a highly foamy, exfoliating and soothing face wash. Best of all, the creamy texture followed by bubbles feel wondrously hydrating on the skin. As a sensitive skin sufferer, with combination skin, this face wash truly feels just right. It cleanses without stripping too deeply, thus leaving my face feeling supple, especially when using with their face cream. It's been two months of use for me and my skin honestly have not felt more gentle and spot free. I'll admit when it comes to pigments and acne scars, this face wash misses the needed salicylic acid to tackle blemishes. On the other hand, for long-term use, this face wash becomes the best option to achieving clean, balanced skin.

product: CeraVe Hydrating Cream To Foam Cleanser Face Wash For Normal to Dry Skin, Hydrates + Removes Makeup without Disrupting the Protective Skin Barrier, Hyaluronic Acid + Amino Acids + Ceramides, 236ml
review: Having purchased for the purpose of the highly touted hylarounic acid ingredient, this cleanser actually includes salicylic acid. The ingredients can be seen on the packaging to this extent as well as a brilliant breakdown on cidecoder. Most of us with acne issues on prescribed creams and gels including benzoyl peroxide need to be extremely careful of what we add to our skin. Salicylic acid and benzoyl peroxide do not mix well and completely strip the skin of its natural moisture barrier when used together... Which can lead to more problematic breakouts and irritation, hence why we opt for products known to help with dry and dehydrated skin. Hylarounic acid isn't listed in the ingredients for this cleanser, instead its sodium hydroxide which is a cousin to hylarounic acid. Kind of a misleading cleanser experience but you live and learn I guess....! Should definitely state more clearly it includes Salicylic-Acid though. Wouldn't recommend for those of us needing a gentle and or hydrating cleanser and on benzoyl or other drying agents.

review: Cerave shower oil cleaner is a highly recommended product for those looking for a soft cleaning that respects and takes care of the skin's natural barrier.Designed specifically for normal to dry skin, its rich and nutritious formula clean without causing dryness, leaving the skin hydrated and comfortable. review: The Cerave moisturizing cleaning oil has proven to be a real blessing for my skin and has become an indispensable part of my daily skin care routine.As someone who suffers from dry skin and is looking for gentle cleaning, I am enthusiastic about this product and would like to share my positive experience. The first impression of this cleaning oil is extremely positive.The light texture feels gently on the skin and leaves a pleasant, not greasy feeling.The wording is enriched with essential ceramids, which help strengthen the natural protective barrier of the skin and to include moisture. The effectiveness of this cleaning oil is impressive.It gently and thoroughly removes dirt, make-up and excess oil from my skin without drying or irritating it.Even waterproof make-up is easily removed while the skin is also supplied with moisture. The versatility of this cleaning oil is also remarkable.It is suitable for all skin types, from normal to very dry skin, and can be easily integrated into my existing skin care routine.I like to use it as a first step in my double cleaning to thoroughly clean my skin and to maintain at the same time. The tolerance of this cleaning oil is another plus.It is free of fragrances and parabens and was developed by dermatologists, which makes it particularly gentle and tolerated for sensitive skin.This gives me the confidence that I use a safe and effective product that is good for my skin. All in all, I can recommend the Cerave moisturizing cleaning oil to anyone who is looking for a gentle and effective cleaning for their skin.With its high -quality wording, gentle effect and tolerance, it is an ideal choice for everyone who strives for healthy and radiant skin.

review: Love this face wash! I take good care of my skin and only want to use the best non irritating products and this is up there with the best. This cleanser is non drying and none irritating. Please note that the cleanser does not come out of the pump container as a 'foam', the liquid becomes a foam after a small amount of water is added which is great as it is more controllable and less messy. The consistency of the liquid is thick which again makes it much easier to control and the fact that it has a pump is another plus. I personally only use this once per day as I do not find it necessary to use any cleanser in my morning routine. Highly Recommend PRO'S: Pump container giving easy controlled access Only small amount required for whole face and neck Large size Value for money Gentle does not irritate skin so ideal for dry or sensitive skin Addition of Ceramides and Squalane Cons: None so far

review: Brings off make up really well, takes off all mascara without having to use a flannel or cloth to scrub at my eyes - impressive cleanser. I had previously used Elemiss cleansing balm, this is a more effective cleanser, but it doesnt have that luxury feel that you might be used to if youve been using those kinds of products. Its a very different product, as it does foam up. Can also be used as a body wash, which doesnt leave the skin dry. I got it on a lightning deal, and it was a good price point (around ). Has left my face feeling hydrated, noticeably better skin texture. I really like the product, just wish it had a more spa-like luxury feel - thats the only thing Im missing from it.

product: CeraVe Hydrating Foaming Oil Cleanser Face Wash For Normal to Very Dry Skin, Suitable For Baby & Atopic-prone Skin, For Face & Body, Squalane + Triglyceride + Ceramides, Fragrance Free, 236ml
review: I bought the Cerave moisturizing cleaning oil some time ago and so far I am quite satisfied with the product.It definitely deserves four stars, even if there is still room for improvements. First of all, the oil fulfills its main task as a cleaner.It easily removes make-up and leaves a pleasantly clean skin feeling.I have normal to dry skin and this cleaning oil seems to harmonize well with my skin type. In addition, I find the ingredients, especially the Ceramide and Squalan, very attractive.They contribute to strengthening the natural skin protection barrier and help to keep the skin hydrated, which definitely benefits my skin. The fact that this product is paraben -free and perfume -free shows that Cerave attaches importance to skin health and security.This makes it a good option for people with sensitive or allergies. However, the fragrance is not my favorite, although it is natural and not intrusive.I would have liked it to be fragrance neutral or have a more pleasant natural fragrance. I also think that the bottle is a bit large and bulky, which makes it difficult to use.Smaller, more compact packaging would be desirable, especially for travel. Despite these small defects, the Cerave moisturizing cleaning oil is a high -quality product that I can definitely recommend.It offers a gentle but thorough cleaning and cares for the skin while it cleans.

review: This is a really good cleanser and one Id purchase again. I use this as either my morning cleanser or as a second cleanse in the evening (when double cleansing to remove spf and/or make up). So I use another brands oil cleanser then follow with this cleanser and my skin feels lovely and soft. While I get a bit of tightness (this is my normal) after cleansing its not exacerbated by using this cleanser. The pump makes it easy to use - however you dont need a full pump, a little goes a long way. I got the cleanser on offer so it felt value for money. It really doesnt have any scent - which I appreciate as sometimes unfragranced items can smell a bit funky!

review: Id been using this cleanser for a while (at least a couple years) and my god was I in love with it. I considered it holy grail level. My skin is incredibly reactive and sensitive so to finally find something that my skin didnt react to but that also did a good job cleansing was amazing BUT THEN in my most recent repurchase earlier this month I put my beloved cleanser on my skin and to my surprise my skin started to burn and tingle! I checked the ingredients and...they had reformulated it and added ingredients with absolutely no indication or announcement of any kind. I was devastated and my skin is currently still healing from the reaction. I wish I had known so that I could have patch tested it.
