product: SKIN1004 Madagascar Centella Light Cleansing Oil 200ml
review: As a facial plastic surgeon, I'm constantly seeking out high-quality skincare products that can benefit both my patients and myself. With the rising popularity of K-beauty products, I couldn't resist trying the SKIN Madagascar Centella Light Cleansing Oil. After using this product consistently for several weeks, both morning and night, I feel confident in sharing my thoughts. I have incredibly sensitive and oily skin, which is prone to breakouts and underlying rosacea. Finding a cleanser that doesn't irritate my skin or exacerbate these issues can be a challenge. However, I'm pleased to report that the SKIN cleansing oil works exceptionally well for my sensitive skin. Throughout my use, I have not experienced any irritation or increase in breakouts. One aspect of this cleansing oil that I appreciate is its light scent. Many individuals with sensitive skin, myself included, can be easily irritated by strong fragrances. The SKIN cleansing oil has a very subtle, pleasant scent that doesn't overwhelm or cause any discomfort. It's important to note that proper application and removal techniques are crucial when using an oil cleanser, as improper use can lead to breakouts. To use this product effectively, begin by applying the oil to dry skin and massaging it well. This allows the oil to break down makeup, sunscreen, and other impurities. Next, wet your hands and massage your face again, creating a light emulsion. This step is essential for ensuring that the oil is fully emulsified and can be easily rinsed off without leaving any residue behind. Finally, rinse the product off your face thoroughly with water. I believe that many people experience breakouts with oil cleansers due to improper application or removal techniques, which can leave an oily residue on the skin. I highly recommend the SKIN Madagascar Centella Light Cleansing Oil for anyone looking for a gentle and effective K-beauty cleanser, particularly those with sensitive or oily skin. By following the proper application and removal techniques, you can enjoy the benefits of this cleanser without the risk of breakouts or irritation. The light scent and high-quality ingredients make this product a valuable addition to any skincare routine.

product: SKIN1004 Madagascar Centella Light Cleansing Oil 200ml

After using it, my skin feels soft, fresh and well hydrated, without the typical sensation of trench that other cleaners leave.In addition, the product has a soft and natural aroma, which makes it even more pleasant to use.The ml presentation is perfect, since a little product is sufficient for each cleaning, so it lasts a lot.If you are looking for an effective and soft cleaner that respects your skin barrier, the Madagascar Centella Light Cleansing Oil is an excellent option.I recommend it a lot!

review: I'm a redhead with sensitive skin, so I was prepared to have the first layer of my skin burned off for having the temerity to try it. I am wowed and sold on this product! Not only does it truly work for sensitive skin (I've had eczema from skincare products and stress, and I struggle with keratosis pilaris, so I'm really that sensitive), it cleared up my acne and KP on my back and arms in less than days. It's a chemical peel, so daily use isn't really encouraged, but I've used it up to -x a week with no reaction. It leaves my skin feeling feather soft, and any acne/KP that does pop up is smaller and easier to exfoliate with a body scrubber. My bacne has been a bane to my existence since I went through hormonal changes (yay menopause!), but this finally cleared it up with the same results I had with FAB KP Bump Eraser, but for less money, more product, and without the need for pumice. Amazing! The only thing I'm not smitten with is the smell, but it's tea tree oil, so the heady mint smell wasn't a surprise to me and worth it if clears up my skin.

So just a caution to how often you use it. I pair it with this other kojic bodywash which really helps to even out my complexion. With continued use, I would expect to see results in two to three weeks. Tip: This body wash is good at cleaning and removing grime/sweat but might be a bit drying on the skin for some due to the cosmetic acids AHA, BHA, and PHA. review: Finding a cleanser that doesnt irritate my sensitive skin has always been a challenge, but the Eau Thermale Avene Tolerance Extremely Gentle Cleanser Lotion has been a game-changer. From the first use, I was impressed by how soothing it felt on my skin. This lotion has a lightweight, milky texture that glides on effortlessly. It gently removes impurities without any harsh rubbing, leaving my skin feeling clean, soft, and comfortable. Theres no tightness or dryness afterward, just a fresh, hydrated feeling. What really sets this cleanser apart is its minimalist formula. Its free from potential irritants like fragrances and preservatives, which is perfect for my reactive skin. While it being also non-rinse is a bonus, especially when my skin is feeling extra sensitive. I'm newer to using cleanser that are so, which is the reason behind my review being four stars instead of five. This cleanser has earned a spot in my routine. If you have sensitive or easily irritated skin, I highly recommend giving this a tryits a true skincare staple.

product: Cetaphil Gentle Cleanser 236 ml, For All Skin Types, Dermatologist Tested for Sensitive Skin, Fragrance Free, Oil Free, Paraben Free, Hypoallergenic, Formulated with Niacinamide
review: Everyone with rosacea will find something different works for them. I thought I would try this because it's cheaper than the La Roche Posay toleriane gentle cream dermo-cleanser that I find works the best, but also feels a bit gross on my skin - slimy. I also don't like how mucousy this feels on my skin, but indeed it does the job without causing a flare up, whichs surprises me because if I leave it on like I always do with cleansers, it gets a bit stingy. Some cleansers also blow out my pores and this doesn't do that. My skin doesn't dry out, and my toner and moisturiser would also have a part to play in that, but overall I would definitely recommend people with rosacea who are looking for a cost effective cleanser should give this a try. If it doesn't work, just give it to someone, if you've got a skin condition, it's not worth forging through the rest of the bottle, trust me, you'll wreck your face.

My skin isn't completely healed from the damage caused by the HARSH CHEMICALS of the cleanser. Please DON'T BUY this one if you have oily yet "sensitive to chemicals" skin type, like mine. review: I tried the Avene product due to my greasy skin type and was curious about the effect of monolaur and zinc gluconate.The texture is pleasant, the fragrance is nice and fresh and the skin feels clean after use. All in all a solid product, but for me not a post-purchase candidate.

product: Anua Hearleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil 200 ml
review: tiktok influenced me to buy this. i saw people saying this made their skin worse, but it worked well for me. for context i am an asian y/o, sensitive skin, dont usually wear makeup, used to have so much acne in the past & acne creams made me sunburnt. i have been trying to take better care of my skin recently. i dont do a patch test but maybe i should? i use this -x a week. really see the gunk coming off especially in the T area of the face. when i use it i do look like i have glass skin xd. it is CRUCIAL to have another water-based cleanser after using this one, sometimes I even apply my water-based cleanser x when my face still felt slippery from this oil. i usually apply it in evenings when I can go shower after just so the shower water can further remove it. it does wonders, if you know how to use it and if it matches your skin. i suggest having this oil first from a friend / family member to see if it is good with your skin prior to buying

product: Anua Hearleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil 200 ml
review: This is a good sized amount of product. I originally was going to use two pumps of the product but after the first pump. I could tell I wouldn't need much more so I added a half pump more. So . pumps total, I could have easily only used . or pump. It felt so nourishing on my skin. Like most other double cleansing oils,any times it can leave your vision a little "foggy" for a moment after using, an annoying but harmless side effect. But to my surprise, I didn't have that experience at all. Every product cleansing oil I've tried has always done that to me. So already it was a plus for me. I'm gently on my eye area so I don't hurt my eyelashes or delicate and thin skin in the eye area..I gently press my fingertips onto the eyelids to "melt" makeup away. I don't ever use a scrubbing motion. This method worked wonderfully as well this time. The cleansing oil spread easily but was not at all runny, nor was it goopy. It was the perfect consistency. No harsh smells or burning or irritating texture against my skin. Great for sensitive and delicate skin. I rinsed my mascara and eyeshadow of easily after seconds of gentle rubbing. No residue left behind and my skin isn't tight and dry and is so wet to the touch. I don't wear much makeup, usually just eyes or long lasting lip color. But I do live in a humid southern USA state and need to get the sticky humid off at the end of a day. Worked wonders. I could have been fine with using just this but I also bought the foam cleanser well and the combination of both was phenomenal for this skincare nerd. I do believe these will last quite some time so makes it great value for the money. Quality skincare and I'm excited to try more of their products! Pics show my eye makeup before applying, after with it on my skin, and after only rinsing it three times. I used a roll of gift wrapping tape for scale of bottle size.. came with a nice an easy to remove sanitary safety clasp to prevent spillage.

product: Anua Hearleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil 200 ml
review: I've been using this product daily, and it's been keeping my skin feeling speckless and non-greasy. It's the exact one that's been going viral on TikTok and social media. product: Anua Hearleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil 200 ml
review: After incorporating this into my skincare routine for a couple of months, I am officially a convert to double cleansing! Ive been massaging the oil into my dry face for a minute before I shower at night, rinsing it off with a little water, then following up with a gentle cleanser in the shower. The oil does a great job of removing my makeup and sunscreen, so by the time I follow up with the second wash, it feels like Im really cleaning my skin, instead of just getting whatevers on the surface off. It took at least a month to see any visible improvement in my skin, but now I have less prominent sebaceous filaments and my pores look smaller. Its definitely worth adding this oil as an additional step in your skincare routine!

product: Anua Hearleaf Pore Control Cleansing Oil 200 ml
review: I recently started using this face cleansing oil and I must say, it has completely transformed my skincare routine. This product provides a deep and thorough cleanse, leaving my skin feeling refreshed, nourished, and incredibly clean. First and foremost, the texture of this face cleansing oil is luxurious. It has a lightweight and silky-smooth consistency that glides effortlessly across the skin. The oil effectively removes makeup, dirt, and impurities without stripping away the skin's natural moisture. One of the standout features of this cleansing oil is its ability to dissolve even the most stubborn makeup. It effortlessly melts away waterproof mascara, long-lasting foundation, and heavy eye makeup, making the cleansing process quick and easy. I no longer have to struggle with multiple products or harsh rubbing to remove my makeup. Furthermore, this face cleansing oil is incredibly gentle on the skin. It does not cause any irritation or dryness, making it suitable for all skin types, including sensitive skin. The formula is free from harsh chemicals and fragrances, ensuring a soothing and comfortable cleansing experience. Additionally, this cleansing oil leaves my skin feeling soft, smooth, and hydrated. It effectively removes impurities and unclogs pores, resulting in a clearer complexion. Even after rinsing off the oil, my skin feels moisturized and supple, without any greasy residue. Moreover, the fragrance of this cleansing oil is subtle and pleasant. It adds a touch of relaxation to my skincare routine without being overpowering or irritating. The scent is light and refreshing, enhancing the overall experience of using this product. Another great feature of this face cleansing oil is its versatility. It can be used as a standalone cleanser or as part of a double cleansing routine. The oil effortlessly emulsifies upon contact with water, turning into a milky consistency that rinses away easily, leaving no residue behind. Overall, I highly recommend this face cleansing oil. It provides a luxurious and effective cleansing experience, removing makeup and impurities while leaving the skin feeling nourished and refreshed.
